author: vors
body:
FullCLR windows host doesn't read keys when run in separate window.
Fix: don't use Start-Process -Wait $false -NoNewWindow $false

Instead, ommit this parameters. Seems like a bug in Start-Process.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: You might want to look at the changes @palladia made to the start/stop process cmdlets. They relied extensively on P/Invokes, but were reimplemented to use only managed code. IIRC this was guarded to use the new code only on Linux, but we think it may make sense to use it on Windows as well, and remove the old, non-cross-platform code.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
Well, in this case we use Start-Process that we ship inbox. I think it's unrelated.

Simple repro:

```
start-process cmd -NoNewWindow:$false
```

cc @lzybkr

title: Fix for #491: make powershell.exe work in new window
